data.title: Russell Crowe addresses rumours he’s married girlfriend Britney Theriot
data.meta_description: Russell Crowe breaks his silence on secret marriage rumours to girlfriend Britney Theriot by denying they have tied the knot.
data.text:
Russell Crowe dismissed rumours he secretly wed his girlfriend, Britney Theriot in Italy last month.

Fans speculated the couple tied the knot after Britney, 39, was spotted with a ring on her wedding finger during an Italian getaway.

All was revealed during a broadcast of the 2Day FM breakfast show when host Erin Molan explained she had contacted Russell, 53, directly to congratulate him on his supposed big news.

Presenters of the show, Hughesy, Ed and Erin began dissecting the rumour mill when Erin revealed she went straight to the source.

Saying she’d contacted the actor, sending him and his ‘new bride’ well wishes, she went on to add Russell was confused by the note.

After Erin suggested her co-worker Hughesy had read something about the apparent marriage and ‘believed it’, Russell replied: ‘Yeah, good guess. We are not married.’

Britney has been in Italy for the last few weeks supporting her boyfriend as he films his latest movie, The Pope’s Exorcist and was leaving her hotel in Rome when the photo sparking speculation was snapped.

She can be seen sporting a canary yellow sundress, round shades and most notably – a silver band around her wedding ring finger.

Confirming their relationship with a tennis court kiss in November 2020, the story stands that the couple first met on set while filming Broken City.

Russell worked on the project in 2013 when Britney was trying her hand at acting before swapping tinsel town for a life in real estate.

Notoriously private about their relationship, the couple have never publicly addressed the details, but did appear on the red carpet together last month when they attended The Poker Face premiere together.

Russell’s relationship with Britney comes after his split from ex-wife Danielle Spencer in 2018, with whom he shares two sons, Charles, 18, and 16-year-old Tennyson, with.
